conclusion: Analyze paths of liquids from points A, B, and C to predict flow into containers D or E.
Yellow liquid flows down from point A.
Yellow liquid encounters a green baffle directing it left.
Yellow liquid hits another green baffle directing it further left.
Yellow liquid flows into container D.
Blue liquid flows down from point B.
Blue liquid encounters a purple baffle directing it right.
Blue liquid hits another purple baffle directing it further right.
Blue liquid flows into container E.
Green liquid flows down from point C.
Green liquid encounters a purple baffle directing it right.
Green liquid hits another purple baffle directing it further right.
Green liquid flows into container E.
Yellow liquid from point A is directed left by green baffles to container D.
Blue and green liquids from points B and C are directed right by purple baffles to container E.
Yellow liquid from point A flows into container D; blue and green liquids from points B and C flow into container E.
